Introduction

By following this schedule you will get everything possible in one playthrough while not requiring a long time reading. This was designed with minimal spoilers of what will happen in the story and the combat. All information that is not required for the 100% like story progression, dungeon exploration, Personas to fuse, enemy weaknesses, and so on, will be separated from the main segment or marked as spoilers. This is done with the sole purpose of letting the player get immersed in this world and get to know its characters and stories. This is a unique experience that can't be found in other games.

Different from the Persona 5 original version, the Royal version doesn't have as many missable trophies, but they can still make you reload a previous save file, or in the worst case, start a complete new playthrough. Since this is a 100% schedule and not a Platinum-only guide, you will get all the trophies in the game by following it but it is still necessary that you pay close attention and do the exact action presented each day. Missing a single action, especially regarding stat increases, Confidant ranks, and items marked as Orange will void the 100%. 

The trophy  Easy Money is the only problematic one in this game, not because of its difficulty but because of its randomness. The day you are able to check out if you won the lottery or not varies depending on the day you bought the ticket. It's recommended that you write it down somewhere to not forget to check in. The schedule will state when you are able to start trying for this trophy. All other missable trophies are easier to track and will be covered in the schedule or can be easily earned on the 31st of January, the only free day in the game.

This schedule does not intend to do any sort of hand-holding during combat segments or story progression. All necessary information to progress the game will be marked as spoilers and boss details will be covered in a separated section. Traversing dungeons will be completely up to the player since the way you do it doesn't affect the Platinum or the 100%, as long as you complete it in the day marked on the schedule.

This schedule will feature:
  • The Platinum Trophy
  • All Confidants at maximum rank
  • All Social Stats at maximum rank
  • Read all of the 46 books
  • Watch all of the 12 DVDs
  • Watch all of the 18 Movies
  • Complete all the 7 Retro Games
  • Get all characters to Baton Pass maximum rank
  • Get Technical Attacks to maximum rank
  • Do all the 33 Mementos Requests
  • Accept all the 10 unique invitations from Confidants to visit places in town
    • We won't be accepting invitations to stay at LeBlanc
    • We won't be accepting invitations to study (except for the first month)
    • We won't be accepting invitations to play darts or go to the Jazz Jin since these aren't unique events
  • Get all the 20 decorations for your room
  • Get all exam rewards from Sojiro
  • Do all the Big Bang Burger Challenges
  • Show all the 13 places in town to the Twinsand Lavenza;
  • Complete all the Challenge Battles
  • Get all the best items for all characters (weapons, guns, and armor). This will be covered in the Recommended Fusion Path section
  • Unlock all chests in Palaces
  • Get all Will Seeds
  • Trade all the 16 items to Sakai
  • Catch both rare fishes
  • Get all 8 dolls from the Akihabara Arcade
  • Get the 5 best skills of the Jazz Jin
  • Answer all crosswords puzzles, class questions, and TV questions
  • Get items from all the shopping programs


This schedule will not contain 2 things due to the lack of in-game days:
  • Thieves Den objectives: side objectives that are designed to be completed in multiple playthroughs. Some of the objectives require you to visit a place several times, “wasting” over 20 days in total. There is no way to do these objectives and get everything above in one playthrough. All the objections can be viewed here. You can plan along the way to complete more but this is not a requirement for any trophy. The rewards from these objectives are “coins” to be used to unlock concept art, music and other things. Unfortunately, those rewards can't be used in the actual game, they can only be viewed in the “Thieves Den” which is a completely separated area accessed from the main menu.
  • Sojiro’s Coffee and Curry Tips: every time you brew coffee or make curry, Sojiro walks in and gives you some flavor text about types of coffee beans and curry ingredients. There is nothing to it outside of a few lines to read but there are 15  curry ingredients and 19 types of coffee beans. To get all of Sojiro's Tips, it's necessary to spend 34 nights. Once again, this is not required for any trophy.


Things to remember while playing:
  • Save the game often. This game has no auto-save feature so if you screw up something, you have to go back all the way to your last save file. It's recommended to save every 4 days (8 time slots), saving before entering a main story dungeon or the side-quests dungeon, and saving when you have reached the end of the dungeon but haven't left yet, as well as when you've completed all side quests but haven't left the dungeon yet. Rotate through the 16 save slots that the game has and there will be over one month of backup saves to go back to if something happens.
  • After the main schedule, there is a Recommended Fusion Path. While it's not necessary to follow it, it was designed to have Personas of all elements kept up-to-date with enemy levels, making the game easier.
  • If you intend to follow the Recommended Fusion Path, always check the Shadow Information when entering dungeons. The Shadow Information table will state the Personas needed to be captured in every dungeon in order for the Recommended Fusion Path to work.
    • If you are not following it, make sure you capture every Persona encountered. The Strength Confidant demands 10 different fusions. While the fusions will always be in the schedule as soon as you are able to make them, it's up to the player to secure the ingredients if not following along with the provided material.
  • This schedule was play tested in both Normal and Merciless difficulties. Regardless of the difficulty you play, all the activities are the same and the Recommended Fusion Path is still relevant. It's not recommended to play on Merciless because it requires a deeper understanding of the game mechanics and fusion system, and it will significantly increase the time necessary to complete the game.
  • Summoning and dismissing Personas during the game is completely normal. Due to the limit of Personas you can carry at a time, it's expected to have a set of Personas used for fighting and another set used in the day-to-day sim life. Dismissing a good part of the roster before entering a dungeon to be able to resummon more battle-oriented Personas is part of the game.
  • Registering Personas in the Velvet Room means that their skills, level, and experience will be saved for the next time you summon them. Remember to always register before fusing, sacrificing, or dismissing.
  • Always have a Persona in your inventory of the same Arcana as the person you are hanging out with. If you are new to Persona, every person in the game has an Arcana ("type") attached to them (Ryuji is Chariot, Ann is Lovers, Takemi is Death, and so on). By having a Persona of the same Arcana as someone you are spending time with, you will earn extra relationship points, making you rank up faster.
    • There are a few cases where a Persona is not needed (Sun, Moon, and Strength) but that information will be stated in the schedule when it happens.
    • There are also Confidants that automatically rank up as the story progresses, so it's not needed to keep Personas for them. They are Magician, Fool, and Judgement.
  • Every time we go to dungeons or start doing side quests, it's necessary to complete everything before leaving, meaning: reaching the end of the dungeon or the blockade and completing all the side quests. This is imperative. It is not possible to get everything in time if not finishing these objectives in the minimum amount of in-game days.
  • Make sure to follow the schedule exactly. Making any mistake may ruin the 100% run, and the only way to fix it is by reloading a save file from before the mistake. Getting a Confidant answer wrong will yield fewer points or no points at all, making it unable to rank up the next time. Skipping stat points may delay that stat rank up, locking you out of an action later on that requires a specific level of that stat.
    • All of this becomes irrelevant when a Confidant is at maximum rank or a stat is already at maximum rank. There is some information that is kept for completion's sake despite not being necessary anymore, i.e. getting the fruit juice in Shibuya while having all stats maxed out.
    • If you missed points with a Confidant and they aren't ready to rank up when you need them to, its possible to fix it by speaking with Chihaya and asking for an affinity reading about the Confidant you missed points with. This is only available after 07/08 and will only work if you manage to get the Confidant ready to rank up before the day you need to hang out with he/she.
  • The schedule structure is a table divided into day-time and night-time. This works for a good chunk of it except for dungeons, since they tend to have more information than your average day. During dungeons, both the day and night column will be unified into one for the sole purpose of not having one side of the columns extremely long while the other has only a few lines.
  • You will have to romance all possible girls, and that occurs because:
    • Some room decorations can only be obtained by being in a romantic relationship.
    • Some Confidants change the time they are available if you are in a romantic relationship with them.
    • Some Confidants won't invite you to go somewhere if you are only friends with them.
    • There is a Thieves Den objective to romance all girls in the same playthrough.
    • There is literally no downside. Shame on you, Atlus.
  • For the early stage of the game only, don’t spend any money unless it says in the schedule that you can. Money is the biggest concern for the first few months of the game and not having enough to buy the necessary items means the 100% will be voided.
  • There is one free day at the end of January that can be used to complete Thieves Den Objectives and any other trophy that you may have missed, like  Intensive Training,  Professional Modification, or  Accident-Prone, for example.


For better visualization, colors are used to mark important things:
  • Green is used for rank ups of Confidants, Baton Pass, and Technical Attacks
  • Blue is used for stats gained and social stats rank-ups
  • Red is used for the infiltration of main dungeons and the side dungeon
  • Grey is used for side quests received and side quest confirmation
  • Orange is used for items received and bonus received

I missed stat points, now what?

The game works with a hidden requirement system that lock players out of certain events or Confidants based on the current Rank of their social stats. This schedule is extremely tight on time which means if the player can't perform a certain action in the day the guide says, the 100% is voided, and reload an earlier save file is needed to make the corrections, if the player has no idea what went wrong in their game there is one last resort to realign with the schedule.

On 07/05 the Fortune Confidant will unlock, she gives the ability to ask for a Lucky Reading by paying 5000 yen. With a Lucky Reading you will gain a stat boost for 1-day that will give (+1) points when performing an action that gives the stat chosen. For example, by choosing to boost Knowledge any activity that gives Knowledge will yield more points for that day like answering a crossword puzzle will give (+2) instead of (+1). For actions that already give (+3) the player will still gain (+4) even though the game can only display 3 points at a time.

By using the Lucky Reading ability its possible to correct minor deviations in the schedule in the case stat points were missed. This failsafe does NOT work all the time because you can only ask for 1 Lucky Reading per in-game day, and when its raining the NPC will not be available. You will also have to wait for days that the schedule will performe an action that you need, if you need Knowledge and the schedule does not have any knowledge activity its possible that you reach a stat blockade before being able to realign.

In the tables below is described all the necessary stat ranks and the days you need to have them. Any stat mistakes before 07/05 can not be corrected.

April

This is a very strict month, there aren't many Confidants to work with and not many places to go. There are also three stats blockades in the near future to worry about, Rank 2 Guts for Takemi, Rank 2 Kindness for Ann, and Rank 3 Knowledge for the early May exams. Using the combined stats Knowledge and Guts gained from studying at the school and the great stats from DVDs will be needed to achieve the needed Ranks in time.
During the Casino tutorial, there is nothing to worry about here. Just keep going forward and enjoy the awesome music.

A level 1 Arsene fused with a level 2 Pixie will only net one inherit skill slot. So if you are not able to pass both Eiha and Zio in this case its because you are slightly underlevel. Farming for levels is not required unless the guide says that you need a specific skill obtained at a specific level

  • This is a very difficult Palace because it’s so early in the game that we don’t have access to Personas, skills, or items to help us out, but we still need to finish it in one day otherwise we won’t be able to get everything in one playthrough. Keep multiple saves just to be safe and use the SP items bought from the vending machines;
  • This Palace features a puzzle where you need to find books in small rooms adjacent to a big library and then fit the books on the right shelves. The northern shelf that has books about the feats of Kamoshida is where you put the King Book. The eastern shelf that talks about girls in the volleyball team is the place for the Queen Book. And finally, the eastern shelf is where the Slave Book goes. After all the books are in place, a new path will open up;
  • Will Seeds are a new mechanic in Royal, there are 3 seeds to collect in every Palace. When all 3 are collected, they will turn into an accessory that gives a powerful skill to the person that uses it. They also recover a bit of SP every time one is collected, which is an huge deal in the early game;
  • Red Seed: 
  • it’s part of the tutorial, your teammates will tell you to go get it;
  • Once you reach the roof, the enemies will become quite strong. It's recommended to skip all the battles until you are inside the castle again. When the Treasure is found, you can farm as much as you like, but for now, focus on reaching the end of the Palace;
  • Green Seed:
  • When you are using the grappling hook to climb the outside of the tower, the Seed will be at the very top. Enter the first window and crawl inside a vent to reach a higher area where you can use the grappling hook to get higher;
  • Blue Seed:
  • Back inside the castle, when the rooms start to shift, take the elevator down. You will see another elevator in the new area that can't be used. Continue through Kamoshida’s painting to unlock a shortcut to the very beginning of the Palace. Explore this area to find a lever that activates the other elevator. Go back through the painting and use the new elevator that we just activated to go down to a new area and fight the first Will Seed Guardian;
  • Reach the treasure and farm until you are level 9 with 20.000 yen;
  • Fuse Silky and Agathion to get Berith (Hierophant, 9);
  • If you don't know who Silky is, the Shadow name can be found in the Shadows Information;
  • Leave the Palace after securing the route to the Treasure, fusing Berith, and getting the necessary money;
  • When you are ready to leave, make sure you have a Lovers Personas;
  • Almost every Sunday, you can check the TV and buy unique or rare items from the Shopping Program. Some of them are useful, others aren’t. This schedule was designed to have the money to buy from the Shopping Program every time;
    • There are always two options to choose from, and you can only pick one
    • Today, the bundles are Spring Awake Set: 10 items that cure sleep and 10 that cure dizzy, as well as a Sleep Immunity accessory OR Share of Spring Set, 5 items that heal 10 SP each, 1 item that heals 40 HP to all allies, and 1 item that heals 80 HP to all allies. It's recommended to buy the Share of Spring Set. SP is too valuable in the early game

It's possible to kill Shadow Shiho to prevent another big attack, she is weak against everything. After that, the game will enter a scripted event asking you to send someone to steal the crown from Kamoshida, while the person climbs the pillar, you will have to keep attacking Kamoshida, being unable to meet the damage requirement will make the person be spotted by Kamoshida and end the scripted event. This is not mandatory, but in lower difficulties it will end the battle a lot faster. On Merciless though, it can be a bad idea because of the lower damage dealt by your team it makes a lot harder to meet the requirement;

05/25
Wed
  • Steal Madarame’s Heart;
  • Before starting the fight make sure Joker has all basic elemental attacks (fire, ice, elec, and wind) and they can’t be the ones that hit all targets, they need to be single target;
  • Boss Ichiryusai Azazel Madarame: Madarame is one of the hardest bosses in the game if not the hardest, and that's for one simple reason, he can hit all your party members' weaknesses in one turn, essentially killing everyone from full HP. The Eyes drain elemental attacks and can cast all basic elemental spells, the Mouth drains physical attacks and attacks normally, and the Nose has Tarukaja and Rakunda. The best way to deal with the first phase is to use Rakunda in the Eyes and have Ryuji and Yusuke use AoE physical attacks (Yusuke needs to be level 18 to learn it) to neutralize the Eyes as soon as possible, with the Eyes out of the picture the boss gets a lot easier. In the second phase, Madarame starts summoning his elemental clones, and as you can expect, they are weak to their opposite element. Use ice against the red clones and fire against the blue, use wind against the yellow clones and elec against the green. Abuse Baton Pass by exploiting all the clones' weaknesses and kill them all in one turn. Just make sure you don’t use any spells that hit all targets because the clones will reflect their element back at you. The beginning of the second phase is a battle of attrition. Don't worry about Madarame, just make sure the clones die. Eventually, the clones will start getting weaker and easier to kill, then you can start getting some damage in Madarame himself;
  • Magician Rank 3;
  • Read the book The Gallant Rogue (8/46) Guts +3;

June

This is the month of money, it will be necessary to get tons of it to start two of the best Confidants in the game. They give the ability to get bonuses to stats and Confidant points without having to spend time (spend money instead). There will be some farming necessary to get the money, but luckily a new part of town opens up where sooty clothes can be sold for good cash.

  • Starting today and until the last day of August, there are two summer-only items available once a week. At the Ginza Line Gate in Shibuya there is a Melon Pan that revives one ally with full HP and costs only 1.000 yen. In the Convenience Store at Shibuya Central Street there is a Soothing Soba that costs only 800 yen and heals one ally for 200 HP;
    • It's recommended to always buy these items, they are cheap compared to how good they are.

  • Go to the new area that unlocked, Aiyatsbus, and find Jose. On the stairs of every floor in Mementos, Jose will put Stamps for you to collect. They can also appear at random on every floor and not only on the stairs. Jose will offer bonuses based on the amount of Stamps collected. Make sure to always collect all the Stamps in every visit to Mementos and prioritize raising the items buff to maximum before anything else;
    • Apart from the Stamps, Jose will also ask you to collect Flowers. They work as a type of currency that you can exchange with him for items. Flowers can be found all across Mementos and you can collect them as you drive by
    • Jose has a random chance of appearing every time you enter a floor. If you want him to appear you can go up and down between two floors until it happens
    • There are 2 Stamps in the previous area so backtrack to get those
    • Sometimes when you get down to another area there may be an ATM to loot for tons of SP recovery items. The ATM appears at random and can give from x6 items up to x12 items at once
  • Once you are done with the 2 requests and have gotten all the Stamps, go back to the entrance and enter the Velvet Room;

  • Farm until you are level 21. This is your last chance to farm 100.000 yen, this amount will be needed by the end of this month. 
    • Keep in mind that you will also need more than 100.000 because there are still day-to-day purchases to make. You will be safe getting 250.000 yen total;
    • Treasure Demons have a higher chance to appear because of the Pollen Warning. They give around 300xp and 6.000 yen
    • If you don't feel like farming all that money, make a save and leave Mementos. On the next day go to the Airsoft Shop and sell all the loot, if it brings you to the required amount you can keep going, if not, reload the game and farm a bit more
  • Once you are done farming and are ready to leave, make sure to have a Councilor, Temperance, Chariot, Lovers, and Hierophant Personas;

  • Steal Kaneshiro’s Heart;
  • Boss Junya Bael Kaneshiro: Pyggitron has fire attacks so having Yusuke means the boss can get 1-Mores every turn, the usual Tarunda and Rakunda combo still works well. After a while Kaneshiro will come out of the robot and prepare the “Super VIP Attack”, be careful with that since it hits pretty hard. Eventually the game will give you an option to throw an expensive item to distract the boss, that in exchange, won’t attack for a few turns. It’s up to you if you want to waste a good item or not. Every member of your group will suggest a different item and only the rarest one will work. Since the items they pick are random there is no way to tell what will work beforehand. When the robot is destroyed, Kaneshiro will summon bodyguards that are resistant to all attacks so the best way to deal with them is to set up Technical Attacks with Dormina or any other status ailments that you can apply. Kaneshiro himself can be put to sleep as well when the bodyguards are defeated. Shiki-Ouji is extremely helpful in this fight, especially in the last phase where the boss will keep using Lullaby and Technical Attacks;

July

The money problem is officially over from this month onwards. Unlocking the Chariot Rank 7 ability means that is possible to farm hundreds of thousands of yen in a short time while doing other things in Mementos, this is faster than the Pulinpa trick in Persona 5 original. In this month there will be new Confidants to start, a new party member joins the team, there are exams again, and it's impossible to leave LeBlanc for an entire week.

  • By this point your Anzu should have learned Dekaja. If not, try to capture Anzus inside the Palace for a big exp boost;
  • Capture a Sandman in this Palace and fuse it with Mandrake to get Sudama (Hermit, 17);
  • When Anzu learns Dekaja enter the Velvet Room and fuse Anzu, Sudama and Kodama in Advanced Fusion to get Neko Shogun (Star, 30), pass on Dekaja;
  • Speak to the twins for Strength Rank 6;
  • In this Palace there is another Treasure Demon, called Stone of Scone (Fortune, 20), capture him. He is weak to fire;
  • Red Seed: 
  • at the very end of the first area, turn left to see a locked treasure chest, climb some sarcophaguses to the right of it;
  • Eventually, you will find a room full of coffins with holograms of globes, this is the puzzle room of this Palace. Find the code B01010 in a stone tablet in the next room. 0 means the globe is turned off and 1 is turned on. Interact with the coffins again and turn the globes on and off accordingly;
  • Green Seed: 
  • after activating the first blue orbs puzzle you will be able to climb the large rolling balls. From the top of the balls, you can access a platform with another puzzle code, R01100 and B10011. Set up the new code in the holograms and press the button again to open a new door in that same room. This new door leads to the Will Seed ;
  • Blue Seed: 
  • when you reach the area on top of the big pharaoh-like statues, use the grappling hook to access floating platforms, this is the normal progression path. When back on solid ground, turn around and go back towards the way you came in from. Kick a plank to unlock a shortcut back to the previous area. Now you can grapple up straight ahead by standing on top of the wooden plank;
  • Reach the door that says "PRIVATE" and interact with it;
  • Leave the Palace when you are ready;
  • As you are leaving the Palace a new type of execution will unlock, the Gallows. In this execution you can sacrifice a Persona to give an experience boost to another, and also get a random skill from the one you sacrificed. This is a great way to level up Personas and unlock new skills. A Persona can only be strenghtened once per day but there is a way to go around the system: strengthen a Persona and register it in the Compendium, after that dismiss it from your inventory. By summoning the same Persona again you will be able to strengthen it more. This method gives you infinite uses of the Gallows with the same Persona on the same day as long as you have the money to keep dismissing and resummoning;
  • Call Kawakami using the yellow phone and request a special massage;
  • Hang out with Chihaya. This will not be a Rank Up.
07/27
Wed
  • Send Calling Card;
  • Equip any accessories that reduce or repel physical damage or give a chance to dodge it. Don’t bring Ryuji into the fight, his weakness to wind will give the boss constant 1-Mores;
  • Boss Beast That Rules the Palace: This boss is so much easier compared to the original game because Futaba will actually block the big attacks for you. When the boss is flying physical attacks won’t work so use guns and spells, keep  Tarunda in effect to mitigate a bit of the damage. When the boss uses Rapid Ascend, it takes two turns for for the big attack to happen, use the first turn to heal and buff, and the second turn Guard with everyone. When Futaba joins the fight you won’t need to worry about Rapid Ascend anymore. Eventually, you will have access to a ballista, send someone to fire it, use Rakunda on the boss, and if you have the item Rasetsu Ofuda that increases the attack for the entire group, use it as well. When the boss is hit by the ballista and falls down, physical attacks will do increase damage. With Rakunda, Rasetsu Ofuda and the bonus from the knocked down you can do tons of damage in one single turn;
  • Call Kawakami using the yellow phone and request a special massage;

October

This month the Tower Confidant becomes a priority because it has a very strict requirement for one of the room decorations; this decoration requires to have already spend a day with him without ranking up and then spend a second day without ranking up again on 10/30, that's the only day in the game where you can get this room decoration without missing a unique event that happens next month.

10/06
Thu
  • Read the book The Art of Automata (24/46) in the metro Proficiency +3 and Proficiency Rank 5;
  • Question: (Joseph-Ignace Guillotin) Knowledge +1;
  • Steal Okumura’s Heart;
  • Before you proceed it's recommended to set up a team of Ryuji, Haru, and Morgana and make sure Joker has access to elec, psy, and wind skills, preferably the ones that hit multiple targets
  • When you reach the place where the treasure was, Okumura will try to escape. You will have 10 minutes to reach him and start the boss fight. Hit  and see if have a Smokescreen. When an enemy shadows notices you, use it and you can prevent the fight. Even if you don't have a Smokescreen, enemies are easy to dodge and time is plentiful;
  • Boss Kunikazu Mammon Okumura: Again, you will have a timer before Okumura escapes but now it's 30 minutes. The boss won’t fight himself, instead, he will keep sending his robots, and you have fought all of them in this Palace already. Keep destroying the robots at the same time by using AoE spells and Baton Passing between the party member that has access to the enemy weakness and Joker. Use Attack Up on all your team with skills or items, defense down on all the enemies, abuse Baton Pass and even use elemental damaging items with someone that can't exploit weakness. Even though these items deal low damage they will enable more Baton Passes. After some time, the actual boss Execurobo MDL-ED will appear. Use Tarunda and your most powerful attacks, use skills or items to remove debuffs, especially Hunger and Defense Down. The items that the priest has available can be really useful in this fight. Guard when he is about to use his “Big Bang” attack because that is quite powerful and can one-shot all your team. Something to note is that if a character is affected with Hunger his “Big Bang” attack will actually fully heal the character instead of doing damage; it can be used in your favor if the time is right. Robot Haru is the last part of this fight and she doesn’t hit hard but will self-destroy when you do a bit of damage to her. When this happens, guard with everyone;

  • Steal Sae’s Heart;
  • Boss Shadow Sae: at first you can’t damage her, so just guard until she asks you to make a bet, choose anything, you will lose anyways. When Morgana asks if you spotted the cheat, answer “I most certainly have” and “There’s a glass lid”. Send someone to break the glass.
  • Boss Sae Leviathan Niijima: when the real fight begins don’t worry about weakness or resistances, just use everything you have. Sae will spin the roulette again, and this time it can land on any element or almighty. Depending on what element it lands on, Sae will start using attacks of that type and will be resistant to damage that is not the counter to that type. For example, if it lands on elec, Sae will take more damage from wind, if it lands on psy, she will take more damage from nuclear. If the roulette lands on almighty, you can use any attack that you want.

He can also use Almighty damage that hits everyone, keep your HP high and debuff his attack and defense; When his HP drops below a certain point, Akechi will summon his second Persona, Loki. He will now start using Tetrakarn, Makarakarn, Brave Blades, and Negative Pile (can cause Despair) as well as having 2 moves per turn. This battle doesn't have any special mechanics;

12/09
Fri
  • Send Calling Card and steal Shido’s Heart;
  • Boss Beast of Human Desires: the beast will use physical attacks on one of your party members or on everyone. The boss attacks twice a turn, normally with one attack and one debuff, and can only be damaged by magic spells. Make sure you have someone that can recover your party stats by using Matarukaja, Marakukaja, and Masukukaja, otherwise this battle can go on a death spiral if he stacks all those debuffs on your team. Try to debuff him and buff your party but don’t use all at the same time because if you go too heavy on buffs/debuffs he will cure his stats ailments and nullify yours. Once the beast grows wings, Shido will start using elemental skills and now can only be damaged by physical and gun attacks. For the third time, the beast will transform, but now it only attacks once per turn and can charge to do one big damage attack. When that happens, use Guard. There are no attack restrictions for the third phase;
  • Boss Masayoshi Samael Shido: in the first half he will only use physical attacks and can cause Fear, so be prepared to heal as soon as it happens. In his second form, he will start using elemental spells as well as act multiple times per turn. Having a Persona that blocks or repels physically will help but it’s not necessary. When Shido gets to about 25% HP he will kick all your team out of the fight and you have to end it with Joker alone. During this part, Shido still uses the same physical attacks as before but this time he will mix in severe magic spells. The spells are always used in the order of fire, ice, elec, and wind, so you can completely mitigate the spell damage by using the right Personas from the Recommended Fusion Path, Moloch drains fire, Black Frost drains ice, Trumpeter repels elec, and Quetzalcoatl resists wind. Shido can still mix in physical attacks in the middle of the spell order so don't let Joker's HP get too low;
  • Read Essense of Fishing (32/46). Now you can use Third Eye to spot Prize Tags when you go fish in Ichigaya.
    • Fishes with Prize Tags will give more points

  • Fool Rank 10;
  • Refuse Igor's deal;
  • Yaldabaoth, God of Control: this boss looks more intimidating than he actually is. Keep him under Debilitate and keep your team buffed at all times. During the fight, he will summon 4 different weapons to fight with him and they all have different HP pools as well as resistances. Information about these weapons can be viewed in the Special Enemies table. When a new weapon is summoned it should be taken care of as soon as possible since they all have their turns and attacks. Having all 4 weapons up at the same time means the boss will have 5 attacks per turn and can kill you before you have a chance to react. This fight features unique status ailments that can be applied to your team. Overall, they don't do much. The worst ones can double the cost of skills, but that's it. Don't hold back on your items like Soma and other ones that can fully heal. It's important that you keep attacking to prevent the boss from amassing his "army" of weapons. Close to the end of the fight, Yaldabaoth will summon all weapons at the same time and start charging up for a massive attack. When this happens, you have 1 turn to attack the weapons and kill as many as you can to reduce the damage of the upcoming attack. In the next turn, make sure to guard with everyone.

January/February

The last month in the game is full of story elements, the free time only starts on the 13th, and even after that, it's necessary to spend time with already maxed out party members to unlock their final Personas. That being said, over half the month is occupied by something, giving us little room to work with.
Date
 Day
 Night
01/01
Sun
  • You can't do anything today.
01/02
Mon
  • First Laboratory Infiltration;
  • During this infiltration you won't be able to freely explore, so just follow the path;
  • Boss Warped Abyss: This fight can be very difficult because you can only use Joker and Akechi. The boss has access to Concentrate, Maragudyne, and Vacuum Wave, so it's extremely important that you don't use a Persona that is weak to wind, preferably use one that is resistant or blocks it. He can also apply Fear and use Almighty skills. Joker will have to be on heal duty during the majority of the fight, leaving Akechi to do damage alone. This means that this battle can take a long time and you may even run out of SP before it ends. Use items when necessary and keep yourself at over half HP.

  • Second Laboratory Infiltration;
  • During this infiltration, you won't be able to freely explore, so just follow the path.
  • Refuse Maruki's deal;
  • Boss Sumire Yoshizawa: you will be fighting this with Joker alone. Sumire only has Bless and Physical Attacks, and she will start buffing herself quite early with skills like Charge and Brave Steps. With her skill Sword Dance, there is a very high chance it will land a critical, especially if Brave Step is active. During this period, switch to a Persona that is resistant or immune to physical attacks. Using a Physical Ointment is also an option to mitigate the damage;
  • Boss Cendrillon and Evil Synthetic Organism: you will fight the first few rounds with only Joker and Akechi. During this phase, just worry about surviving. When your team arrives, use the first round to rearrange the party as you want. Cendrillon will use the Evil Synthetic Organisms to heal 600 HP every couple rounds. Make sure to kill them using Nuclear or Ice attacks. Chain Baton Passes and get the last person to hit Cendrillon for major damage.

  • Boss The Shadowed One and Spear-Wielding General: the General is weak to Elec but there is a very high chance that the Shadowed One will cast Elec Wall to protect his weakness, the wall will be active for a few turns and get immediately put up again when it expires. Because of that, exploiting weaknesses in this fight is a luxury. The Shadowed One has no weaknesses and casts Mabufudyne, and the General has One-Shot Kill and Charge. This combination makes them very dangerous since they can trigger Technical Attacks by combining their skills. Status ailments don't have a high chance to work but they can keep one of them out of the fight until you do some damage to the other. You can also trigger your own Technical Attack, knocking one down and Baton Pass for some extra damage.

  • Now you can grind the "Visit 15 times" Thieves Den objectives, wash clothes by yourself, score 30 home runs, and other objectives that require multiple visits to a place. Save the game, go to the same place you want in both afterschool and evening, and reload;
    • As a reminder, these objectives are not required for the Platinum
    • By this point you should have all the trophies except for the ones tied to the end of the story. The ones that you are missing are  Take Back the Future and The Path Chosen
  • You can go train in Shibuya Central Street Protein Lovers Gym if you have any Protein items you can use to increase the effects of training. The Imported Protein is the better one, followed by the Moist Protein. The normal Protein gives the smallest bonuses.
    • Training will increase your maximum HP and SP
    • You can't get the Thieves Den objective for training since you need to do it 16 times and reloading the save doesn't count
02/01
Wed
  • Go to Yongen-Jaya Movie Theater and watch the movie The Goodfather (18/18) Kindness +2.
  • This is a free evening. Do whatever you want to pass the time.
02/02
Thu
  • Answer the phone message and hang out with Sumire;
  • Sumire's Awakening.
  • Maruki will stop by LeBlanc and offer you a deal again. You need to refuse;
  • After completing all the requirements in this schedule: accepting to be Akechi's rival, defeating him in the one-on-one fight, and not forgetting about him after the events in Shido's Palace, Akechi will ask you a question and you need to answer "We're stopping Maruki";
  • Akechi’s Awakening.
02/03
Fri
  • The Final Battle;
  • Maruki and Azathoth: this is the first fight in a total of 3, back-to-back. During this phase, Maruki will be protected by Azathoth's tentacles and you can't hit him without dealing with the tentacles first. When Maruki is defeated, this phase will end so you don't need to worry about Azathoth. The tentacles all have different resistances and weaknesses that will be covered in the Special Enemies section. Abuse Baton Passes by exploiting the tentacles' weaknesses and hit Maruki in the 4rd Pass. The boss can cause Fear and Dizzy that should be healed as soon as possible, having Akechi in this fight is bad since he is weak to bless, one of the boss' attacks;
  • Maruki and Adam Kadmon: in the second phase you will be fighting Maruki "alone". Only he can be targeted and you should focus everything you have, your best skills and most powerful combos, because Maruki will grind you down if not dealt with quickly. His skill Revitalize Soul deals a fixed 300 damage to everyone and heals Maruki by 1200, and Grand Palm leaves one person with 1 HP despite their defenses, so you need to hit him quickly and hit him hard to end this phase as fast as possible. Use Charge and Concentrate as well as Debilitate to do as much damage per attack as you can;
  • Adam Kadmon: phase three is the easiest. It is a scripted battle and all you have to do is resist for a few rounds until the cutscene starts. Keep healing, guarding, and debuffing the boss' attack.

Recommended Fusion Path

  • This table shows fusion information throughout the game to keep your Personas up-to-date with levels, skills and enemy weaknesses;
  • Sacrificing Personas for Items or Skill Cards not only requires a specific Persona but also base "ingredient" items. The items needed are called Black Items, and they are: Black Kogatana (weapon), Black Robe (armor), Black Rock (accessory), Model Gun (gun), and Blank Card (Skill Card)
    • You won't have the materials to sacrifice Personas for items in the early game unless you are using the DLC that gives these Black items. As the game progresses and you start acquiring them, you can come back and sacrifice anything you missed;
  • Sometimes you will have to immediately resummon a Persona after using it for fusion or sacrifice. If you are encountering enemies where Joker can't exploit their weaknesses, this is because you forgot to fuse or resummon a Persona;
  • The "skills" column shows what to inherit and also what skills that Persona can learn that are useful. It's not necessary to learn all the skills from all the Personas since that would take a long time;
    • It's impossible to know for sure how much players will grind and what skills they will learn so only the skills that the Personas start with or really important skills are shown in the table
  • After getting to Strength Confidant Rank 5 you can pay money to fuse Personas of a higher level than your character. In the early game where money is a huge problem, it's not recommended to use this feature. Money will stop being a problem after unlocking Chariot Rank 7;
  • If you are following this, you will need to also follow Shadow Information because that table details the Personas to capture in each dungeon for this Fusion Path to work;
  • Treasure Demons work as a special fusion where the Persona will go up or down the list in their same Arcana depending on their level;
    • Andras, for example, is a level 27 Persona of the Devil arcana that, if fused with the Treasure Demon Queen's Necklace, will result in the next Persona in the Devil Arcana, Lilim at level 32
    • If Andras is already at level 32 or higher, fusing it with Queen's Necklace will yield a different Persona than Lilim, in this case Pazuzu which is from the Devil Arcana of level 45.
    • Another example is when fusing Clotho, the second Persona of the Fortune Arcana. Clotho's base level is 27 and fusing her with Stone of Scone will result in the third Persona of the Fortune Arcana which is Lachesis, level 35. But if Clotho is higher than level 35 and fused with Stone of Scone it will skip the third position of the Fortune Arcana and go directly to the forth position, this fusion will then result in Atropos of level 39.
  • This list will eventually get to the Personas and sacrifices required for the best weapons, guns and armor for all party members.
    • This process starts at level 64 (or earlier if you are using the Strength Rank 5 ability)
    • Keep in mind that there is more than one "best" in slot for every character. All items have different attack and defense values as well as passive skills. The best item for a character will heavily depend on your team's composition and the role of that character on the team
    • The items listed here are considered the best for the characters primary role and will work in any composition or situation


For better visualization, colors were used to mark important things:

  • In Bold are the skills to inherit during fusion
  • In Italic are the good skills that the Persona can learn as it levels up
  • In Green and Bold Green are Strength Confidant Ranks and its requirements
  • In Orange and Bold Orange are items that can be obtained by sacrificing Personas and the best item for party members
  • In Bold Red are Personas that can only be fused once a Confidant reaches rank 10

Special Enemies

Kamoshida's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Dirty Two-Horned Beast
 4
 Elec
 Both of these enemies appear in the same "mini-boss" fight, which is an introduction battle for Ryuji. Exploit the Dirty Two-Horned Beast weakness with Ryuji, then when the Guard Captain is alone, you can focus on him.
Guard Captain (1st Visit)
 3
 None
Guard Captain (2nd Visit)
 5
 Fire
 This enemy is part of the introduction battle for Ann. Combine fire skills from Ann and Jack-o'-Lantern and use All-Out-Attacks when the boss is down.
Heavenly Punisher
 9
 None
 He will always use the skill Charge that doubles the attack power of this next attack. In this fight, it is very important to have the skill Tarunda that decreases enemy attack damage. This skill can be learned by Ann and the Persona Bicorn. Mix attacks and guards with everyone while keeping the boss under the effect of Tarunda.
Torn King of Desire
 12
 None
 He guards the Blue Seed of this Palace and resists all elemental attacks. Use Technical Attacks that can be set up with Ann’s Dormina or any other status ailment like Burn, Shock or Freeze, then follow up with a physical attack. Items have a higher chance to inflict status ailments than normal skills.
War-Hungry Horseman
 16
 Elec
 This boss does huge damage and can kill anyone in the party with one attack. Make sure to have Ann use her Dormina skill to prevent the boss from moving. He is weak to Elec so Ryuji and Joker can exploit All-Out-Attacks during the fight.

Madarame's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Night Chimera
 20
 Fire
 This is the same Nue you will fight normally in this Palace but during this encounter you will have only Joker and Ryuji. Use Fire but don't All-Out-Attack since, with only 2 team members, the damage will be quite low. Try to apply Forget with Ryuji's Headbutt skill to prevent the boss from doing any damage.
Foolish Monks
 11
 Ice
 This is the battle to introduce Yusuke, but on the contrary to the other introductory battles, this one is actually a challenge. Foolish Monks can cast Sukukaja, making them hard to hit, and the Embittered Blacksmith has no weaknesses.

Try to kill the Foolish Monks as fast as possible and use Tarunda on the Blacksmith to reduce his damage output. Having someone in heal duty during the entire fight and try to keep everyone at full HP to avoid being kill by the Sledgehammer skill.
Embittered Blacksmith
 15
 None
Monk of the Valley
 ??
 None
 This boss can be inflicted with all sorts of status ailments so despite him not having any weaknesses you can still knock him down by setting up Technical Attacks and then All-Out-Attack. Don't use Morgana since the boss blocks wind attacks.
Awakened God
 ??
 Wind and Nuclear
 He guards the Blue Seed of this Palace and has Flash Bomb and an AoE medium damage physical attack that can inflict Dizzy, which he will capitalize on with Psi, doing tons of damage with a Technical Attack.

Luckily, he has 2 weaknesses to take advantage of. Someone with the Breeze Ring from Kamoshida's Palace, another with the Atom Ring from this Palace, plus Morgana and Joker skills, will enable a 4-person Baton Pass or an All-Out-Attack after every move.

Kaneshiro's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Chivalrous Fiend
 20
 None
 You will find these guys in this Palace, but in your first infiltration they are considered mini-bosses. They resist physical and gun attacks while having no weaknesses so Ann's Dormina skill will work great to set up Technical Attacks. They are also susceptible to insta-kill skills like Mudo, Hama or items like the Straw Doll.
Raging Water Demon
 21
 Nuclear
 This battle introduces Makoto and can be dangerous because of the two Chivalrous Fiends that fight alongside the boss. The boss itself is weak to Nuclear, but All-Out-Attacks won't come easily since Chivalrous Fiends can't be knocked down without a lucky critical. Status ailments will shine here. Again, neutralizing 2 out of the 3 enemies will prevent a lot of damage. Mudo, Hama and Straw Dolls are still an option against the Chivalrous Fiends as well as Technical Attacks.

You will have a second battle against the Raging Water Demon later on, but during the second encounter he will be alone so use Nuclear skills followed by All-Out-Attacks.
Tornado Devil
 26
 Elec
 Use his weakness to Elec and All-Out-Attacks.
Samurai Killer
 27
 None
 This is a combined battle of the three Demons. You can exploit the weakness of the Raging Water Demon and Baton Pass to someone else to knock down the Tornado Devil. The Samurai Killer on the other hand has no weaknesses, he can be inflicted with status ailments like shock and freeze, so use Technical Attacks against him.
Life-Draining Spirit
 ??
 Bless
 He can use a skill called Bloodbath that deals significant damage and can inflict your team with Fear. Having Makoto with you is recommended because she has Energy Drop that can cure it. Apart from that, use his weakness and inflict status ailments.
Guard Dog of Hades
 ??
 Ice
 He guards the Blue Seed of this Palace, and as always, these guardians can be quite strong. This one has access to level 3 "dyne" skills and uses fire element, so having Yusuke in this fight will enable the boss to get 1-Mores. Try not to let the boss get an attack out by using Ann's Dormina and other status ailments that you have access to. Don't use All-Out-Attacks because the boss will recover from the ailments instantly and attack back.

Futaba's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Raging Bird God
 29
 None
 Even though this boss doesn't have any weaknesses, he is quite susceptible to status ailments, especially Shock. Using Joker's gun that we get from Iwai or Elec skills in general will easily set up Technical Attacks.
Coffin-borne God
 38
 Wind
 You will have to fight him twice in this Palace. The first time, he is alone but can summon more enemies and turn your team into rats. While in rat form, you can't do anything and you will take major damage. The fact that he summons other shadows actually makes this fight easier as using those shadows to get Baton Passes and 1-Mores will do major damage when attacking the boss.

The only difference from the first to the second battle is that in the second, he already starts with Shadows summoned.
Decadent False God
 ??
 Fire
 He guards the Blue Seed of this Palace and is probably the easiest guardian in the game. He repels physical and guns, and absorbs ice. Use Joker and Ann to exploit the boss' weakness and Baton Pass to each other. Don't try to get a Technical Attack using physical because he will reflect back. The only way to get a Technical Attack is by inflicting him with Burn, Shock, or Freeze and then using Nuclear skills.

Okumura's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Haru's Fiance
 29
 Psi
 As expected, the fight to introduce a new team member has a boss that is weak to that team member's skills. Have Morgana and Ann on the team and use them to exploit the weakness of the Blue Robots. Baton Pass to Joker and then to Haru for both to hit the main boss.
Blue Robot
 24
 Fire and Wind
 You will fight all these robots in this Palace, during the exploration as well as during the final boss fight. They are all weak to 2 elements (except the black one) and resist everything else. They have the ability to heal each other, self-destruct, and call for reinforcements. Try to always take them out at the same time by using AoE skills and Baton Passes.
Yellow Robot
 24
 Ice and Psi
Red Robot
 24
 Elec and Nuclear
Light Blue Robot
 24
 Wind and Bless
Green Robot
 24
 Psi and Curse
Black Robot
 24
 None
Pagan Savior
 ??
 Wind
 He guards the Blue Seed of this Palace and has the skill God's Hand, a severe damage physical attack, and the skill Hama that can insta-kill anyone in the party including Joker. Don't use Bless or Curse against him, try to Baton Pass between Joker and Morgana and never use a Persona that is weak to Bless.

Niijima's Palace

Shadow
 Level
 Weakness
 Details
Wandering Reviver
 54
 Psi and Bless
 She has some very powerful magic, single target and AoE, as well as the ability to apply Brainwash. Use a combination of Joker, Akechi and Haru skills while Baton Passing to each other.

 He has Concentrate, a skill that doubles the damage of magical attacks, AoE spells, and a high chance of applying Shock to your team. Without any weakness, resistance to ailments and a considerable HP pool you will need to have Tarunda and Rakunda in effect at all times while slowly working on his HP bar. Be aware that a party member inflicted with Shock can be Technical Attacks by the boss, but there is a chance that the Shock will transfer to the boss himself, allowing you to Technical Attack him in return.

With that in mind, all you have to do is equip Personas accordingly, Girimehkala can reflect physical attacks and Thunderbird heals from elec attacks, with this combination you literally can't lose.

 84 None This is the last mini-boss in the game. He is immune to Physical and Elec and resists Guns and Ice. Fusion Alarm

This is a new mechanic introduced in Persona 5 Royal that gives bonuses to any action in the Velvet Room while the Alarm is active. This mechanic will be unlocked when you have secured the route to the treasure in Kaneshiro's Palace.

The Alarm has a chance of activating every time you win a battle. After winning, a red door will appear onscreen to show that the Alarm is in effect. When an Alarm is active, every time your team goes to a safe room, Joker will mention that he should check out the Velvet Room.

The Velvet Room will change to red, the music will change, and the voiced lines of the Twins and Igor will be more "serious".


The effects of a Fusion Alarm are:
  • Personas fused during the Alarm will get more stats and can change their skills to other ones. The skill that can change will be marked as red after the fusion completes and you will be asked if you want to allow the change or not. The skills that are selected are random and can change to random skills as well. It is a throw of the dice if you will get better or worse skills;
  • Sacrificing Personas will give you an upgraded version of the normal item. Equipment will be stronger (with more defense or attack), accessories will give a different skill, and skill cards will be upgraded to the stronger version of them or to the AoE version of them;
  • Doing anything inside the Velvet Room during an Alarm can result in a failure. Registering and Resummoning Personas are still 100% guaranteed to work. If the Alarm fails, you will be kicked out of the Velvet Room and the Alarm will stop until you trigger another one by winning fights. 
    • The result of a failed fusion will be a different Persona than the one you selected but with the same inherited skills
    • The item you get from sacrificing a Persona will be completely random, with high chances of being a Skill Card and low chances of being an accessory. How powerful the random skill card and accessory will be depends on the level of the sacrificed Persona
    • Failing in the Gallows execution will yield no experience to the selected Persona, but instead give it random stat increases
  • The chance of failure will increase based on how many things you did during that Fusion Alarm. Fusing Personas will increase the chance of the next fusion failing, sacrificing Personas will increase the chance of the next sacrificing failing, and summoning any Persona will increase the chance of failure if you do anything that involves the Persona you just summoned;
  • The chance of failure also increases when you do the same action multiple times, for example, sacrificing the same Persona over and over everytime there is a new Fusion Alarm. The reason for this is to prevent the player from getting too many of the same items. If you want several X Skill Cards, you will need to sacrifice for a X Skill Card, then in the next Alarm, sacrifice for a Y Skill Card, and on the third Alarm, you can get another X Skill Card, and so on;
  • The chance that a Fusion Alarm will happen can be increased by using the Fortune Rank 10 ability, Celestial Reading. It costs 20.000 yen to instantly trigger a Fusion Alarm, but also increases the chance that one will happen after winning battles during that day;
  • Leaving the Velvet Room while an Alarm is in effect will automatically cancel the Alarm.

Challenge Battles

These challenges are new to Persona 5 Royal and are completely optional. They are not required for any trophy, Confidant rank, or Thieves Den objective, but they give items to be used during the game as rewards for beating specific scores.

When you get to the second Palace of the game, Challenge Battles will unlock. When they unlock you can enter the Velvet Room at any time, talk with the Twins, and ask for a "special battle". If you access the Challenge Battles from inside a Palace, it will heal both the HP and SP of your team to full, and after it ends, the values will be restored to what they were before. Because of this, you don't need to worry about doing a Challenge Battle only when fully rested or only when outside a Palace.

Challenge Battles don't give a Game Over screen and you can instantly escape the battle at any time. You can try the same battle as much as you want even if it's already completed. The battles are divided into 5 levels and you need to beat the previous one to access the next. These divisions do not work as restrictions and you can fight any battle despite what level your characters are. New Challenge Battles can be accessed via paid DLC but this guide will only feature the ones that come with the base game.

Battle 1

Enemies:
  • Round 1: Jack-o'-Lantern, Jack Frost, Kelpie, Koropokguru
  • Round 2: Onmoraki, Apsaras, Mokoi, Inugami

Rewards: 
  • 10.000 points - Copper Lump
  • 20.000 points - Duke's Coat (75 defense mans only armor)
  • 25.000 points - Ember Ring (Gives the skill Agi)

Equip Ann with the Breeze Ring from Kamoshida's Palace and make sure Joker has access to ice skills. During the first round, use Joker or Ryuji to hit Kelpie with elec and Baton Pass to Ann. With the Breeze Ring and her natural fire skills she can kill all the remaining enemies. On the second round, use Joker to hit Onmoraki with ice and pass to Ann again.

Battle 2

Enemies:
  • Round 1: Rakshada, Shiki-Ouji, Leanan Sidhe
  • Round 2: Anzu, Orthrus, Fuu-Ki
  • Round 3: Naga, Take-Minakata, Sui-Ki

Rewards:
  • 15.000 points - Silver Lump
  • 28.000 points - Dodge Ice Skill Card
  • 35.000 points - Heat Wave Belt (Gives the skill Heat Wave)

Equip Yusuke with the Atom Ring from Madarame's Palace and make sure Joker has access to wind, elec, and psi skills. Between Joker, Ann, and Makoto, all enemies of the first round can be killed, leaving Yusuke to finish off the stronger Shiki-Ouji.

During round 2, do the same thing but without Ann (unless Yusuke can't kill the last enemy), then Baton Pass to finish it off.

In round 3, Take-Minakata is a problem due to his big HP pool. Use psi to knock him down, and if he is not dead after the Baton Passes, use Dormina before his turn to prevent damage.

Battle 3

Enemies:
  • Round 1: Decarabia (Disaster Shadow), Thoth, Black Ooze (blocks all attacks)
  • Round 2: Unicorn, Belphegor, Mithras
  • Round 3: Kushinada, Arahabaki, Ose, Lilim

Rewards:
  • 20.000 points - Gold Lump
  • 35.000 points - Mazionga Skill Card
  • 43.000 points - Spiral Rasetsu Anklet (Gives the skill Matarukaja)

Equip Morgana with the Heat Wave Belt from Challenge Battle 2 and Ann with the Breeze Ring from Kamoshida's Palace. For round 1, the only option is to kill the Decarabia so that the explosion kills the Black Ooze, which is immune to all damage. You need to do enough damage for it to work, otherwise the explosion won't kill the Black Ooze. If that happens, escape the fight and try again.

For round 2, Joker needs a Persona that has both Curse and Psy so he can knock down the Unicorn and the Mithras and Baton Pass to Ann. With all enemies knocked down, Morgana can end the round with Heat Wave.

Joker needs a Persona that has Bless and Psy for the third round because this is the only way to deal with the Ose and the Arahabaki. Makoto can exploit the weakness of Kushinada. If you think Morgana won't be able to finish off the enemies, Ann can use a Lullaby for Technical Attacks.

Battle 4

Round 1: Girimehkala, Hope Diamond, Ganesha
Round 2: Black Frost, King Frost, Jack Frost
Round 3, Yamata-no-Orochi, Rangda, Mara

Rewards:
  • 25.000 points - Platinum Lump
  • 38.000 points - Heat Up Skill Card
  • 46.000 points - Miracle Belt (Gives the skill Miracle Punch)

Equip Ann with the Spiral Rasetsu Anklet from Challenge Battle 3 and Ryuji should have Shock Boost as a skill, or equip the Portable Battery accessory found in Kaneshiro's Palace. For this Challenge Battle, status ailments will be crucial. Joker needs to have a Persona with Marakunda, an AoE ice spell, and a strong skill that is not resisted by the round 3 enemies. For that, One-Shot Kill will do. In round 1, all three enemies are resistant to physical attacks, so inflict Ganesha with Shock while Ann uses Matarukaja, Akechi knocks down Girimehkala, and Joker the Hope Diamond. If you are low-level, Joker needs to use an AoE ice spell, otherwise Ryuji won't be able to kill the Girimehkala.

Round 2 is the easy one. Exploit the weakness of the Black Frost and the Jack Frost with Ryuji and Ann. Joker can kill the King Frost with One-Shot Kill or with Garula if he is inflicted with Burn, then Akechi ends the round.

During round 3 you need to be careful since both enemies can kill you quite easily. Apply status ailments again to increase the damage output and knock them down.

Battle 5

Round 1: Beelzebub
Round 2: Valkyrie, Odin, Thor
Round 3: Metatron

Rewards:
  • 15.000 points - Diamond Lump
  • 30.000 points - Life Aid Skill Card
  • 40.000 points - Supreme Ring (Gives the skill Megidolaon)

This challenge battle is all about inflicting enemies with elemental ailments (shock, freeze, burn) and having Makoto use her Nuclear skills to trigger Technical Attacks. Round 1 against Beelzebub will be used mainly for buffing the team. Joker uses Debilitate or Rakunda to decrease the enemy defense, Ann uses her High Energy skill to give Concentrate to the entire party, and Makoto uses an item that gives her Charge, or just guards. The most important move in the first turn is Ryuji to apply shock, and that can be done with his skills if he has Shock Boost, or with a Shock Magatama found in Mementos. The second turn of Round 1 is Joker using Bless skills to knock the enemy down and Baton Pass to Makoto for her to trigger a Technical Attack on the shocked enemy. If the first round is executed correctly, it will give enough points to get all rewards.

In Round 2, Joker uses Marakunda or the Cleaning Spray that can be bought from the Clothes Shop in Kichijoji to decrease the enemy defenses. Ryuji uses the President's Insight from the Okumura's Will Seed accessory to Concentrate Makoto. In Ann's turn, she uses her fire skills to kill Valkyrie and Baton Pass to Joker to use the Down Shot skill to knock down Odin and Thor. The 3rd Baton Pass goes to Makoto so she finishes the round.

Round 3 against Metatron is the easiest, he is weak to elec and can be shocked the same way as the enemy in the first round. Here, Makoto can use the skill One-Shot Kill from the accessory obtained by sacrificing Seth during a Fusion Alarm, Gun skills trigger Technical Attacks in shocked enemies. If Metatron is not dead yet, Joker and Ryuji can finish the battle by exploiting weaknesses. Overall, this is the easiest challenge battle because you have so many options to work with. In a perfect scenario (as in the video below), you can get over 10x the necessary points.

Jose's Flower Shop

The Flower Shop is a new addition to Royal and it starts as soon as you enter Mementos for the first time after the tutorial. The same way there are loot boxes to collect as you drive around, in Mementos, you can also encounter Flowers. These can be exchanged for items in Jose's Shop.

Jose can appear on any floor of Mementos. When he is available, a small cutscene of him driven by you will play as soon as you enter the floor. You can see the location of his Shop by opening the map with .

The items that are available in his shop will change as you progress to deeper floors. Some items will be replaced by others, some will be completely new, and some that had a limited stock will have more for sale. Also, any Will Seeds that you missed during a Palace can be purchased from the shop after the Palace's deadline. Every time that an item goes out of stock, it will replenish the next time you enter Mementos.

You have to spend all your Flowers before leaving Mementos, otherwise they will be lost.

Thieves Den Objectives

It is not possible to get all the Thieves Den Objectives while getting everything else, although, by following along with the schedule, you will end up completing a fair few. In this table, all the Thieves Den Objectives will be listed in case you want to complete more. These objectives are not needed for any trophy.

This table will mark every object differently based on the final result after reaching the end of the schedule:
  • Done: this objective is completed during the schedule;
  • Possible: if you keep reloading the save file on the free day of January, you can complete this;
  • Player Input: it can be completed but depends on the player going for it since it's not possible to have it in the schedule;
  • No: this is not possible unless you start New Game +.
